title: 郭术涛课题组 |  CURRENT OPINION IN CHEMICAL BIOLOGY-南大功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室
content: 郭术涛课题组 |  CURRENT OPINION IN CHEMICAL BIOLOGY-南大功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室 首页实验室概况实验室简介组织结构学术委员会教授委员会新闻动态实验室新闻实验室动态行业动态研究团队人员概况师资队伍科研团队科技创新科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文学术交流交流与合作举办学术会议学术活动通知仪器平台实验室大型仪器学校仪器平台开放基金开放基金开放基金项目运行管理工作年报运行管理办法评估规则实验室规章制度文件下载  新闻动态科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文  近期发表论文当前位置：首页     > 科技创新     > 近期发表论文     >         正文郭术涛课题组 |  CURRENT OPINION IN CHEMICAL BIOLOGY发布人：    发布时间：2024/12/20   浏览次数：  次Advances in acid-degradable and enzyme-cleavable linkers for drug deliveryByZhao, S (Zhao, Sheng) [1] , [2] ; Yu, N (Yu, Na) [3] ; Han, HS (Han, Hesong) [1] , [2] ; Guo, ST (Guo, Shutao) [3] ; Murthy, N (Murthy, Niren) [1] , [2]View Web of Science ResearcherID and ORCID (provided by Clarivate) SourceCURRENT OPINION IN CHEMICAL BIOLOGY        arrow_drop_down       Volume84DOI10.1016/j.cbpa.2024.102552Article Number102552PublishedFEB 2025Indexed2024-12-17Document TypeReviewAbstractDrug delivery vectors have the potential to improve the efficacy of therapeutics, including small molecules and nucleic acidbased drugs. However, challenges remain in developing linkages that enable the precise and efficient release of therapeutic cargo in response to mildly acidic environments or lysosomal enzymes. This review highlights recent advances in acid-degradable acetal/ketal and enzyme-cleavable linkages for endolysosomal release. These innovations include the developments of azido-acetal linkers with improved stability and synthesizing asymmetric ketals and their applications in drug delivery, and enzyme-cleavable linkers activated by cathepsin B or b-galactosidase.上一篇：刘遵峰课题组 | ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS下一篇：李昌华课题组 | SMALLCopyright 功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室  版权所有 天津市卫津路94号 　　　--相关链接--中华人民共和国教育部                    中华人民共和国科学技术部                    国家自然科学基金委员会                    ————————                    天津市科学技术委员会                    天津市自然科学基金                    ————————                    南开大学                    南开大学科学技术处                    南开大学化学学院                    郭术涛课题组 |  CURRENT OPINION IN CHEMICAL BIOLOGY-南大功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室 首页实验室概况实验室简介组织结构学术委员会教授委员会新闻动态实验室新闻实验室动态行业动态研究团队人员概况师资队伍科研团队科技创新科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文学术交流交流与合作举办学术会议学术活动通知仪器平台实验室大型仪器学校仪器平台开放基金开放基金开放基金项目运行管理工作年报运行管理办法评估规则实验室规章制度文件下载  新闻动态科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文  近期发表论文当前位置：首页     > 科技创新     > 近期发表论文     >         正文郭术涛课题组 |  CURRENT OPINION IN CHEMICAL BIOLOGY发布人：    发布时间：2024/12/20   浏览次数：  次Advances in acid-degradable and enzyme-cleavable linkers for drug deliveryByZhao, S (Zhao, Sheng) [1] , [2] ; Yu, N (Yu, Na) [3] ; Han, HS (Han, Hesong) [1] , [2] ; Guo, ST (Guo, Shutao) [3] ; Murthy, N (Murthy, Niren) [1] , [2]View Web of Science ResearcherID and ORCID (provided by Clarivate) SourceCURRENT OPINION IN CHEMICAL BIOLOGY        arrow_drop_down       Volume84DOI10.1016/j.cbpa.2024.102552Article Number102552PublishedFEB 2025Indexed2024-12-17Document TypeReviewAbstractDrug delivery vectors have the potential to improve the efficacy of therapeutics, including small molecules and nucleic acidbased drugs. However, challenges remain in developing linkages that enable the precise and efficient release of therapeutic cargo in response to mildly acidic environments or lysosomal enzymes. This review highlights recent advances in acid-degradable acetal/ketal and enzyme-cleavable linkages for endolysosomal release. However, challenges remain in developing linkages that enable the precise and efficient release of therapeutic cargo in response to mildly acidic environments or lysosomal enzymes. This review highlights recent advances in acid-degradable acetal/ketal and enzyme-cleavable linkages for endolysosomal release. These innovations include the developments of azido-acetal linkers with improved stability and synthesizing asymmetric ketals and their applications in drug delivery, and enzyme-cleavable linkers activated by cathepsin B or b-galactosidase.Advances in acid-degradable and enzyme-cleavable linkers for drug deliveryAdvances in acid-degradable and enzyme-cleavable linkers for drug deliveryAdvances in acid-degradable and enzyme-cleavable linkers for drug deliveryAdvances in acid-degradable and enzyme-cleavable linkers for drug deliveryAdvances in acid-degradable and enzyme-cleavable linkers for drug deliveryByZhao, S (Zhao, Sheng) [1] , [2] ;
